what-it-does: Checks for unsupported format types in format strings.
why-is-this-bad: An invalid format string character will result in an error at runtime.
example:
# `z` is not a valid format type.
print("%z" % "1")

print("{:z}".format("1"))

example-split.example-before:
# `z` is not a valid format type.
print("%z" % "1")

print("{:z}".format("1"))
example-split.example-after:
# `z` is not a valid format type.
print("%z" % "1")
